title: Is it Time for Computational Creativity to Grow Up and start being Irresponsible?

author: Colin G. Johnson, School of Computing, University of Kent

segmentation: OK so so thank you.
So yes I want to talk about responsibility and so.
Here's the basic shaker.

What I've got to talk about is, is is a concern that perhaps computational creativity is in danger of getting bogged down in trying to assign responsibility to a particular component of a complex system of complex interactive system.

You could say if you removed any one of these, then the work produced wouldn't be the same or wouldn't exist, and therefore they're all in some way responsible for that that final work.
So what we tend to do is we tend to have this bias towards proximate causes, so we tend to see the immediate action of making the work as the site of the responsibility.
